title: Smash Burger with Special Sauce
description: Crispy-edged smash burgers with a tender, juicy center topped with melty American cheese and a tangy, creamy special sauce. Cooked on a hot flat top or skillet to create maximum crust and layered with pickles and shredded lettuce for classic balance.

ingredients.notes: divide into 4 equal loose balls (~113g each), do not overwork

ingredients.display_name: potato buns or soft hamburger buns

ingredients.notes: use full-fat mayo for best texture
slice very thin for quick crisping
oil the griddle/skillet so patties don't stick
to season beef; use half during cooking if preferred

steps.text: Make the special sauce: whisk mayonnaise, ketchup and yellow mustard in a bowl until smooth; cover and chill while you prepare the rest.
Portion the beef into loose balls (no compacting) and season lightly with half the salt and pepper just before cooking; warm a large cast-iron skillet or flat top over high heat until smoking-hot.

Add neutral oil to the hot surface, place 2 beef balls spaced apart, and immediately smash each ball flat with a heavy spatula or burger press until very thin; hold pressure for 10–15 seconds to set the crust.
Season the exposed patty tops with remaining salt and pepper; cook without moving until deep brown crust forms, about 2 minutes, then flip and cook the second side for 30–45 seconds.
Place a slice of American cheese on each flipped patty and cover the skillet or press gently to melt the cheese for 20–30 seconds; remove patties to a warm plate and repeat with remaining beef balls.
While remaining patties cook, butter the cut sides of buns and toast them on the skillet until golden, about 30–60 seconds per side.

Assemble burgers: spread special sauce on both bun halves, place shredded lettuce on the bottom bun, add the hot cheeseburger patty, top with pickles and thin sliced onion, then crown with the top bun.
Serve immediately while patties are hot and crusty; provide napkins as these burgers are juicy and the sauce is creamy.
